es.uc3m.baldo.opinais.core.algorithms

Class EvolutionaryAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.uc3m.baldo.opinais.core.algorithms.AbstractAlgorithm
      • es.uc3m.baldo.opinais.core.algorithms.EvolutionaryAlgorithm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Algorithm
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CoEvolutionaryAlgorithm

    public class EvolutionaryAlgorithm
extends AbstractAlgorithm
    EvolutionaryAlgorithm.

    Implements an evolutionary algorithm.

    The evolutionary algorithm evolves a population of detectors, based on their fitness, which is calculated as the number of recognized individuals minus the number of false positives.

    A roulette selector method is used to select individuals. Uniform crossover and bit mutation is implemented to reproduce and mutate detectors.

    Author:
    Alejandro Baldominos

    • Constructor Detail

      • EvolutionaryAlgorithm

        public EvolutionaryAlgorithm(int speciesSize,
                     double typeBias,
                     double generalityBias,
                     double crossoverRate,
                     double mutationRate,
                     double elitism,
                     int maxGenerations)

        Builds a new evolutionary algorithm.

        Parameters:
        speciesSize - the size of the detectors population.
        typeBias - the probability that a randomly created detector detects self individuals.
        generalityBias - the probability that a bit in a randomly created detector is a wildcard.
        crossoverRate - the probability that crossover is performed over two parent detectors to obtain a child.
        mutationRate - the probability that mutation is performed in a bit in the detector schema.
        elitism - percentage of the best individuals to be maintained across generations.
        maxGenerations - the maximum number of generations of the algorithm.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public Classifier run()

        Runs the evolutionary algorithm.

        The evolutionary algorithm evolves a population of detectors, based on their fitness, which is calculated as the number of recognized individuals minus the number of false positives.

        A roulette selector method is used to select individuals. Uniform crossover and bit mutation is implemented to reproduce and mutate detectors.

        Specified by:
        run in interface Algorithm
        Specified by:
        run in class AbstractAlgorithm
        Returns:
        a classifier which maps a type to the best detector found by the algorithm for that type.

      • generateChildDetector

        protected Detector generateChildDetector(Selector selector,
                             CrossoverOperator crossover,
                             MutationOperator mutator)

        Generates a new child detector.

        Parameters:
        selector - a selector which will provide two parent detectors.
        crossover - a crossover operator to cross the two parents into a child detector.
        mutator - a mutation operator to mutate the child detector.
        Returns:
        a child detector after crossover and mutation operators are applied.

      • fitness

        protected double fitness(Detector detector)

        Calculates the normalized fitness for a detector.

        The fitness is calculated as the number of individuals correctly classified minus the number of false positives. This way, the fitness function penalizes the cases when the detector detects the wrong type of individuals.

        The fitness is normalized in the range [0,1] to prevent negative filters, which may cause malfunctions in some selectors, such as the roulette.

        Parameters:
        detector - the detector whose fitness is to be calculated.
        Returns:
        the detector fitness in the range [0,1].

      • filterDetectors

        protected java.util.List<Detector> filterDetectors(java.util.List<Detector> detectors,
                                       Type type)

        Filters a list of detectors, i.e., returns only those detectors in the list which have the specified type.

        Parameters:
        detectors - a list with all the detectors.
        type - the type of the detectors to be filtered in.
        Returns:
        a sublist of the original list containing only the detectors of the specified type.
